page.title: 19TWO SCHOOLS IN HARROW
page.content: There is a four-tier educational system in Harrow. Young people attend First Schools between 5_8 years, Middle Schools between 9_12 years, High Schools between 13_16 years and (if they wish) Sixth Form Colleges post 16 years. The latter will become Tertiary Colleges in 1986. All state schools are non-selective. STANBURN MIDDLE SCHOOL has about 380 pupils. It was built in 1938 on a 4.5 acre site in open fields. Huts were added in 1945 and new classroom blocks in 1968. Its roll has dropped in recent years as birthrates reduce. CANONS HIGH SCHOOL has about 720 students. It was opened in 1954 as Downer Grammar School. It became comprehensive in 1974. Its roll has also declined recently but should now stabilise. It is a multi-ethnic school committed to education for all.
